title: EL CONFLICTO DE CHECHENIA, de Carlos Taibo ESTUDIO PRELIMINAR DE UN CONFLICTO CONTEMPORÁNEO
summary: Situación de Chechenia en la última década, marcada por un contexto histórico de gestación del conflicto. Este trabajo hace un análisis de los datos aportados principalmente dentro el campo de estudio del ámbito español en relación a los trágicos sucesos en la pequeña marca territorial del Cáucaso. En él pretendo hacer también referencia a otros autores a susodicha temática. Espero que esto ayude a otros a comprender como se mueven las fichas de un tablero de ajedrez, y que ejerce de gravedad en ellas para impulsar un movimiento o otro hacía la destrucción de ambos jugadores dentro del conflicto, gracias.

research_interests.name: The Chechens In The North Caucasus Region

title: JEJAK DAN JEJAKAN WAHABISME (Proses Transmisi dan Akulturasi Wahabisme ke Lombok
summary: Wahabi satu dari sekian gerakan Islam puritan, yang sebelumnya tiarap dan hanya menjadi kelompok-kelompok sel dan termarjinalkan terlihat paling menonjol akselerasi dan penetrasinya dalam membangun jejaringnya di tengah komunitas Islam Indonesia. Dalam kurun waktu tidak begitu lama kelompok ini telah membangun kekuatan dan basisnya di berbagai daerah yang “dikuasai” kelompok-kelompok Islam moderat semisal NU, Muhammadiyah, NW, dan lain-lain. Tak terkecuali di Nusa Tenggara Barat di Pulau Lombok khususnya, komunitas wahabi ini hampir mencover keseluruhan wilayah Lombok mulai dari kota hingga ke pelosok-pelosok desa. Walaupun dari segi kuantitas jumlah penganut wahabi di Lombok tidak terlalu signifikan, akan tetapi jargon kembali kepada Al-Qur’an dan Sunnah yang mereka praktekkan secara real mampu mempengaruhi, menyihir dan mendapat tempat “khusus” di hati masyarakat Islam Sasak.

title: Life of Muhammad ibn Abdulwahab
Connaissez-vous l'Islam et les musulmans ?
summary:
Le but de ce travail de recherche, est de mettre en lumière cette religion qu'est l'islam et de la présenter de manière objective. Pour cela, l'explication de la croyance y est détaillée.

En seconde partie de travail, les groupuscule "extrémiste, salafiste" sont cités ainsi que la naissance de la doctrine sectaire appelé Wahabbites et l'explication de leur idéologie.
Le but: démontrer que les musulmans sont innocents de leurs actes.

title: JENAYAH ILMIAH ZAMIHAN MAT ZIN: KAJIAN ATAS CERAMAHNYA DI MASJID NEGERI MELAKA
Muslim renaissance and modernity: Reinterpretation and new challenges with special reference to Kerala
summary: Post modern criticism destroys the stereotypes and prejudices of modernism. The renaissance is closely related to modernism, but whenever talk about “Muslim Renaissance” it does not favor of modernism. In nowadays Muslim renaissance became the object of incisive commentary as it is the byproduct of European 'enlightenment' and post colonial intellect. This paper discuss the Recent issue related to the opening of Ijthihad, by which the terrorists’ attack is justified, so this include the source of ideas to Al Qaeda and the problem is either related to opening of Ijthihad or not. Women empowerment ,annihilation of Arabic – Malayalam, resistance or unislamic traditional festival and others are become the challenge of reformative (Islahi) organizations, especially, in Kerala.

title: Jemen - the Proxy War
summary: The military operation in Yemen is significant departure from Saudi Arabia's foreign policy tradition and customs. Riyadh has always relied on three strategies to pursue its interests abroad: wealth, establish a global network and muslim education and diplomacy and meadiation. The term "proxy war" has experienced a new popularity in stories on the Middle East. A proxy war is two opposing countries avoiding direct war, and instead supporting combatants that serve their interests. In some occasions, one country is a direct combatant whilst the other supporting its enemy. Various news sources began using the term to describe the conflict in Yemen immediately, as if on cue, after Saudi Arabia launched its bombing campaign against Houthi targets in Yemen on 25 March 2015. This is the reason, why author try to answer for following questions: Is the Yemen Conflict Devolves into Proxy War? and Who's fighting whom in Yemen's proxy war?" Research area includes the problem of proxy war in the Middle East. For sure, the real problem of proxy war must begin with the fact that the United States and its NATO allies opened the floodgates for regional proxy wars by the two major wars for regime change: in Iraq and Libya. Those two destabilizing wars provided opportunities and motives for Sunni states across the Middle East to pursue their own sectarian and political power objectives through "proxy war".

title: The power of words: the deficient terminology surrounding Islam-related terrorism
summary:
Terms usurped and capitalised upon by Al-Qaeda and other similar terrorist and extremist organisations have a special place in Islamic culture and a particular resonance with Muslim populations. The aforementioned terrorist groups normally utilise these terms in order to further their objectives and gain, first, the support of larger audiences and, ultimately, legitimacy for their actions. At the same time, Western policy makers,
security agencies and, crucially, the media have also used and regurgitated the same terminology in an uncritical fashion. This article explains the semantic nuances behind
terms like “Islamic”, “Islamist”, “fundamentalist”, “Salafi”, “Wahhabi” and “jihadi terrorism”, and the potential that such use has for the alienation of moderate segments of the Muslim creed and the obstacles it raises for intercultural counter-radicalisation
efforts. The article then suggests the adoption of a more-nuanced term by Western circles – one that is equally embedded in Islamic culture and its value system and one that
is not as negligent or power-related as the ones that are currently used.

title: Boko Haram, une impossible sociologie politique ?  Afrique contemporaine, n°255, 2015/3,
summary: Cet article propose de déconstruire la lecture globalisante et le label « Boko Haram » pour contribuer à une sociologie politique du mouvement et de la violence armée dans la région du bassin du lac Tchad. Il s’appuie sur des entretiens, notamment avec des déplacés, et des observations réalisées au cours de plusieurs terrains de recherche. L’auteur met en lumière les dynamiques de prédation, la faculté du groupe de créer du lien politique et de se connecter aux dynamiques sociales locales. Boko Haram est un mouvement hétérogène avec des formes de liens politiques et d’implantations locales précises. Enfin, les dynamiques du conflit dépassent largement les racines de Boko Haram et agrègent des acteurs aux ambitions, rationalités et savoir-faire différents.

title: KARYA SYAIKH MUHAMMAD BIN ABDIL WAHHAB (1115 - 1206 H): USHUL AS SITTAH

title: El empoderamiento islámico y la expansión del radicalismo en Occidente.
summary: En el siguiente artículo se presentan algunos de los aspectos principales para lograr comprender los procesos de empoderamiento y de expansión del Islam radical (islamismo político). El esquema de crecimiento de las comunidades islámicas dirigidas por fundamentalistas (wahabistas o salafistas) y la manera con la que se hacen con el control de zonas importantes de países occidentales pone en relieve el problema de establecer normas propias en estas comunidades basado en las normas de la sharia islámica y queriendo ampliarlo a otros grupos de la misma sociedad.

title: Religious, Ethnic and Linguistic Diversity [Extract of Chapter 3 from Muslim Merit-making in Thailand's Far-south]
summary: This chapter describes how ethnic identifications, language and religion in present-day Cabetigo have been affected by the Thai and Islamic influences described in previous chapters. While the Muslims in Cabetigo are comfortably bilingual ethnic Malays who adhere to traditionalist expressions of Islam, significant religious, linguistic and ethnic diversity exists. The chapter begins by describing how reformist and revivalist movements dealt with in the previous chapter have increased religious diversity—even division—in Cabetigo. I delineate the various ways in which Muslims identify themselves, but also the factors that affect which strategic identity is chosen at any given time and place. This chapter concludes with an account of how the bilingualism in Cabetigo brought about the widespread adoption of Thai by urban Malays.

title: PERJALANAN HIDUP UMAR BIN AL KHATHTHAB: SEBUAH PERKENALAN (RADHIYALLAHU 'ANHU) Oleh Rimbun Natamarga
summary: Umar bin Al Khaththab radhiyallahu 'anhu adalah salah seorang sahabat Rasulullah shallallahu 'alaihi wa sallam yang dekat dengan Rasulullah. Sejak masuk Islam di tahun ke-6 setelah Rasulullah diangkat menjadi nabi. Umar menjadi salah satu pembela Rasulullah. Kiprah Umar di samping Rasulullah tercatat dalam sejarah, meskipun kebanyakan orang mengingat kiprah Umar ketika menjadi khalifah kaum muslimin.

title: The forming of Saudi Arabia and the challenges in its international relations
summary: Saudi Arabia is regional power which shapes the international relations in the Middle East. The establishment of the state and the sources of its legitimacy through which proclaims itself as the protector of Islam shape its specific relations with other countries in the Middle East. Today's biggest challenges for the country are maintaining the legitimacy of the monarchy internally and its leadership in the region, which is under challenge from her most ideological and geopolitical rival Iran. The challenge is also how to maintain longstanding alliance with the United States and the connection with this great power which radical extremists strongly exploit to deligitimizes the county as "a leader in the Islamic world." And finally how to deal with oil price shocks which is the living source of the country. In this paper we will try to answer the question whether Saudi Arabia led a strong regional foreign policy to maintain a strong influence from Tehran, which undermines the legitimacy of the state and its place in the Islamic world? Also we will try to present external challenges which the state sees as very threatening for the Kingdom and the policies undertaken for those challenges. The behavior of Saudi Arabia as a regional power has its source in that it is seen as the protector of "correct Islam" and as such should be a leader in the region so it is of great importance to know the possible outcomes from the challenges that the country have to address.

research_interests.name: History of the Modern Middle East
US Foreign Policy Towards Saudi Arabia

title: An Anthropological Perspective on the Mosque in Pakistan
summary: The mosque occupies a central position in the social as well as religious life of Muslims. It is not only a place of worship where rituals are performed, but also serves as a social space where Muslims take part in welfare activities. The design and architecture of the mosque have local as well as global influences, representing religious, economic, and esthetic dimensions of Muslim social organization. Therefore, Muslims' association with the mosque has much significance from social, political, and economic perspectives. Based on an ethnographic example, this report aims to highlight the use of mosque space in the cultural context of rural Pakistan. In addition to discussing the sociospatial relationships around the mosque, I discuss how Muslims' beliefs about the world and the afterlife shape these relationships.

title: The history of wahabism - how a sectarian islam become the islam
summary: Hamadi Redissi, professor of political sciences at the university of Tunis describes in this concise work (Une histoire du wahhabisme, Seuil 2016) how the dogmatistic  ideology of a "pure islam" is combined from the beginnings of Abd al-Wahab  (18th century) with political power claims. Anticolonial resistance and conservative reforms have led to the idea of an islamic state against all who refuse the same level of belief and are open for different interpretations of the Qur'an. Therefore Arabia today does not present only a fundamentalistic and hereretic islam, but has become a box of Pandora which is a danger for a peaceful living together worldwide and an alarming challenge to all other ways of thinking and religious faiths.

title: "Terrorismo en Francia" Respondiendo a las falacias que justifican el terror
GLOBAL TERRORISM: A Conflict of Fundamental Ideologies
summary: In 1945, World War II officially ended and all the superpowers of the world ironically pledge to set the bar higher for human rights and values. A product of one such determination, the Nuremberg trials defined for the first time what would constitute war crimes, a definition that has stuck till today. Through my paper we will venture into the evolution of global terrorism from the traditional methods of seeking to establish territorial and colonial dominance (18 th and 19 th centuries) to our modern day warfare which has shifted its stance to profit making, draining resources, annihilating cultural identities and accumulating nuclear power for world dominance. Further we will make pit stops in our voyage, throwing light upon the major events during the cold war and the post-cold war scenario that have molded contemporary nomenclature of global terrorism, and set off the infiltration of capitalism into this. It was only in the aftermath of the cold war that a new wave of religious and state-sponsored terrorist forces crept up, which ultimately escalated into much of the forms of global terrorism as we know today. Simultaneously, the current fascist face of certain forms of Islam today cannot be viewed only as some oppressed victim of allied western powers. These are now self-sustaining outfits that dwell upon the popular will and religious alliance to the Caliphate. The paper will shed light upon the unlit corners of the tangible and intangible atrocious effects of global terrorism and analyze the role of the UN as an international peace-maintaining force through strategic developments of agencies like the Counter-Terrorism Committee (CTC) and Counter-Terrorism Implementation Task Force (CTITF), while also imposing sanctions on already war-torn, economically-depressed countries. Diversifying the research we will also examine the Indian side of terrorism and elements of proxy war with China and Pakistan. The paper will briefly touch upon cases ranging from Nuremberg to Hague, decided and sub judice cases of war on terrorism post 9/11. It is not about choosing sides; it is a conflict of fundamental ideologies.

title: Overcoming Terrorism through Capitalist Economics.pdf
summary: This undergraduate thesis paper discusses the theoretical concept of how to defeat Islamic terrorism through the use of Capitalist Economics as has been done among the nations of the Gulf Arab states.

title: Securitising identity: the case of the Saudi state
summary: Why has the relationship between the state and the Islamic revivalist movement known commonly as &#39;Wahhabism&#39; persisted under Saudi rule since 1744? In Securitising Identity Ben Rich traces the symbiosis between these two entities across three distinct periods of Saudi rule over the past four centuries, showcasing the consistent conditions, patterns of behaviour and political logics that surround their interplay. Collectively, these reveal a recurrent tendency in which the state paradoxically offers protections to the preservation of revivalism while generating threats against this same religious identity in order to ensure its hold on power. Such a pattern, he argues, not only transcends all discrete periods of Saudi rule, but also manifests regardless of the conservative or progressive nature of a particular administration. Understanding such a pattern not only helps to explain why Saudi Arabia today remains a source of regional sectarianism, but also how such an idiomatic ideology has endured…

title: La ley del talión a la francesa
summary: El ataque francés el domingo 15 de noviembre contra Raqqa en respuesta a los atentados del viernes 13 en París, no compensa nada. El enemigo más allá de estar en un Estado de facto, se encuentra compartiendo el mismo techo que los europeos, compartiendo su propio “espacio vital”.
